title.narrative: Bridging support to African Economic Research Consortium (AERC) 2014-15
Bridging support to African Economic Research Consortium (AERC) 2014-2015

description.narrative:
Med detta beslut föreslås att Sverige breder en insats med stöd till African Economic Research Consortium (AERC) avseenden perioden januari 2014 – juni 2015 med totalt 18 MSEK. För närvarande är AERC inne på det fjärde året av genomförande av sitt strategiska plan för perioden 2010Mars 2015 och söker stöd för resterande perioden januari 2014 juni 2015.
AERC grundades 1988 och är ett offentligt ickevinstdrivande organisation som arbetar för att främja forskning och utbildning inom ekonomisk politik. AERC uppdrag är att stärka den lokala kapaciteten för att utföra oberoende, rigorös utredning av problemen i hanteringen av ekonomierna i Afrika söder om Sahara. Således AERC bidrar till att stärka den lokala forskningskapaciteten att bedriva politiskt relevant ekonomisk utredning, främja bibehållandet av en sådan kapacitet, och verka för dess användning i politiska sammanhang. AERC Programmet har två huvudkomponenter: forskning och utbildning.
Sverige har stöttat AERC sedan starten 1988 i form av bas och öronmärkt stöd. Det totala stödet under perioden 1998 -2013 har uppgått till 188,7 MSEK av vilket står 53.6 MSEK for nuvarande avtals period 20102013. Av detta uppgick 48 MSEK till bas stöd och resterade till öronmärkt stöd till att öka kvinnors deltagande i nationalekonomi forskning och utbildning under 20112012.
AERC styrande struktur består av styrelse (5-18 Institutions direktörer som väljs av Fund Members), programkommittén, akademiska styrelsen och sekretariatet. För närvarande tillhandahåller 19 internationella biståndsorgan, stiftelser och afrikanska regeringar ger omkring 50% bas stöd till AERC i line med organisations strategi for perioden 2010mars - 2015 (AERC planerar en extern utvärdering av sin nuvarande strategi under 2013).
Sverige ingår i gruppen stora bidragsgivare (Fund members) tillsamman med Bill och Melinda Gates Foundation, Departement for International Development (DFID), Danmark (utrikesministeriet), Kenyas regering, MacArthur Foundation, Norska byrån för utvecklingssamarbete (NORAD ); US Agency for International Development ( USAID ) och Världsbanken ( IBRD ). Sverige är inte bland de högsta givare den årliga svenska stödet är ca . 12% av den totala AERC finansiering men har varit konsekvent genom hela organisationens existens.
AERC bedöms av Sverige som en institution med hög vetenskaplig kvalitet och kompetens och ett mått på detta är det stora antalet publikation in international peerreview tidskrifter. Standarden på AERCs Kapacitetsuppbyggnad bedöms som hög och de har producerat många Afrikanska forskare (Master och PhD nivå). Vidare, AERC nätverkets medlemmar viktiga befattningar i ministerier finanser och banker som medfört en bättre ekonomisk utveckling politik.

This decision suggests that Sweden provides a bridging support to African Economic Research Consortium (AERC) regarding the period January 2014 June 2015 with a total amount of 18 MSEK. Currently, AERC is on the fourth year of implementation of its strategic plan for the period 2010 March 2015 and is seeking support for the remaining period January 2014 June 2015.
The African Economic Research Consortium (AERC), established in 1988 is a public notforprofit organization devoted to the advancement of economic policy research and training. AERC's mission is to strengthen local capacity for conducting independent, rigorous inquiry into the problems facing the management of economies in sub-Saharan Africa. Thus, AERC exists to enhance the capacity of locally based researchers to conduct policy-relevant economic inquiry, promote the retention of such capacity, and encourage its application in the policy context. AERC programme has two primary components: research and training.
Sweden has supported AERC since its inception in 1988 in the form of core and earmarked support. The total support during the period 1998- 2013 amounted to 188.7 MSEK of which 53.6 million are for current agreement period 2010-2013. Out of this core support was 48 MSEK and the rest earmarked support towards improving women's participation in economics research and training during 2011-2012.
AERC’s governing structure consists of Board of Directors (5 -18 Institutional Directors appointed by the Fund Members), Programme Committee, Academic Board and the Secretariat. There are currently 19 international aid agencies, foundations and African Governments providing 50% core support in line with the organization's strategy period 2010 March - 2015 (AERC plans to undertake an evaluation of the strategy in 2013).
Sweden is among major contributors (fund members) to AERC together with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation; Department for International Development (DFID); Denmark (Ministry of Foreign Affairs); the National Treasury, Government of Kenya; the MacArthur Foundation; Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation (NORAD); US Agency for International Development (USAID) and the World Bank (IBRD). Sweden is not among the highest donors - the annual Swedish support is about 12% of the total AERC funding - but has been consistent throughout the existence of the organization. AERC is assessed by Sweden as an institution with high academic quality and excellence and a measure of this is the large number of publications in international peer-review journals. The standard of AERC's capacity building is high and they have produced many African researchers (Masters and PhD level). Furthermore, AERC network members hold important positions in ministries of finance and banks and therefore leading to better economic development policy.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: AERC has achieved a number of results during the bridging phase. One of the results was to draw lessons from the previous period and write a new Strategic Plan. The new Strategic Plan includs many of the areas Sida finds important, for example inclusive capacity building. Inclusive capacity building aims at strenghtening universities and researchers from fragile and post-conflict countries. The bridging phase shows slow results in diversification and inclusion and was thus a challenge for AERC.
The new agreement was signed in December 2015 and is a support of AERC's strategic plan for 2015-2020. The results framework for the new agreement used 2015 as the baseline. The Conclusion on Performance in 2016 (on 2015) was written on the new contribution and based on the results framework in the new contribution.
As a consequence, the results for 2015 in this report, was reported by AERC within the new results framework. 2015 was thus the first year of implementation of the new strategic plan and there were some delays in the implementation. The delay was partly caused by delay in start-up of new activities and because of donor budget cuts. Thereby the results presented for 2015 in this report should be regarded as rough estimates.
